sen.j: 本感寺（ほんかんじ）は、京都府亀岡市に所在する日蓮正宗の寺院。
sen.e: Honkan-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Honkan-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Honkan-ji Temple is a temple of the Nichiren Shoshu sect located in Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は妙種山（みょうしゅさん）。
sen.e: Its Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Myosyusan.

Its Sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Myoshusan.

sen.j: 開基は日蓮正宗大石寺第67世法主日顕上人。
sen.e: The 67th Hossu (head priest) of the Nichiren Shoshu sect Taiseki-ji Temple, Nikken Shonin (The Venerable Nikken) was Kaiki (patron of a temple in its founding).
